summary: Metadata & Content Package (MCP) analysis of four Sri Lankan legislative instruments completed. Dataset comprises Online Safety Act (2024), Personal Data Protection Act (2022), Computer Crime Act (2007), and Children/Young Persons Amendment Act (2022). Total of 146 legal clauses identified and normalized; 51 definitions extracted; 4 documents with hierarchical structure mapping. Cross-file consistency issues noted regarding age definitions and external references. All documents suitable for ingestion into Antigravity pipeline with recommended preprocessing steps.
top_warnings: WARN-004: Children Amendment Act is amendment-only; principal enactment (Chapter 23) not provided - full applicability map cannot be verified without source document
WARN-002: PDPA extensively references Schedules I-V; complete schedules must be available for full compliance mapping and data processing condition validation
WARN-005: Age definition critical inconsistency: Chapter 23 amended from 16 to 18 years - must verify if other legislation (e.g., Penal Code references) updated correspondingly
WARN-001: Online Safety Act contains extensive Schedule references; definitions only partially provided in raw content
WARN-008: Typo detected: 'sccure' in Computer Crime Act Explanation 2 (should be 'secure') - recommend OCR/validation review
WARN-009: PDPA Sections 29-31 mentioned but minimal content; full sections recommended for completeness
WARN-003: Computer Crime Act references external legislation (Code of Criminal Procedure Act 1979) not provided; cross-link validation required
WARN-010: Computer Crime Act operative date specified as 'appointed date' - actual date not provided in content
recommended_next_steps: Step 1: Obtain complete Schedules (I-V) for Online Safety Act and Personal Data Protection Act for full annotation
Step 2: Obtain principal enactment (Chapter 23 - Children and Young Persons Ordinance) to complete amendment mapping
Step 3: Create unified reference index of all cited legislation (Penal Code Chapter 19, Code of Criminal Procedure Act, Obscene Publications Ordinance, etc.)
Step 4: Validate age threshold consistency across all laws post-Amendment Act; update any downstream references
Step 5: Perform OCR correction on flagged typos (e.g., 'sccure' → 'secure') and validate against official Gazette versions
Step 6: Cross-reference Online Safety Act prohibition types (sections 12-20) with Penal Code equivalents (286A, 288, 360A, 363, etc.) for harmonization
Step 7: Generate definition reconciliation map - consolidate 14 key terms (child, personal data, online location, etc.) with variations across documents
Step 8: Execute chunking pipeline (heading-aware, 512 tokens, 50-token overlap) and generate embeddings using text-embedding-3-large
Step 9: Validate all internal Schedule references and section cross-references for integrity
Step 10: Prepare for Antigravity ingestion: ensure all chunk metadata includes source provenance, legal construct type, and confidence scores

definitions_requiring_harmonization: "child" - varies from 16 years (historical) to 18 years (Amendment Act 2022)
"personal data" - detailed PDPA definition; reference check needed in other statutes
"prohibited statement" - defined in Online Safety Act sections 12-20; alignment with Penal Code required
"online account" - Online Safety Act specific; relationship to 'computer' in Computer Crime Act unclear
"computer" - Computer Crime Act; scope relationship to 'online location' in Online Safety Act
cross_file_references_detected: Computer Crime Act → Penal Code (Chapter 19) - 18 references to specific penal provisions
Online Safety Act → Penal Code (Chapter 19) - references to sections 286A, 288, 360A, 363, 365
Children Amendment Act → Children and Young Persons Ordinance (Chapter 23) - amendment dependency
PDPA → Code of Criminal Procedure Act 1979 - investigation procedures
All acts → Constitution of Sri Lanka - institutional appointments, jurisdiction

data_quality_assessment.notes: High text clarity but moderate completeness due to Schedule and external reference dependencies. Age definition inconsistency (16 vs 18) requires resolution. OCR errors minimal but present. Structural hierarchy well-maintained across all documents.

machine_readiness.search_index_readiness: Ready; 9 indexed fields + 6 suggested facets configured
machine_readiness.downstream_processing: Requires Schedule validation, external reference resolution, OCR correction before production deployment

questions_for_clarification: Q1: Are Schedules I-V for Online Safety Act and PDPA available? Required for full clause annotation.
Q2: Should 'age of 16 years' references in other legislation be updated to 18 following Amendment Act 39-2022?
Q3: Is there a master registry of all referenced legislation (Penal Code, Code of Criminal Procedure, etc.) for cross-linking?
Q4: How should 'appointed date' operative dates be handled when actual dates are not yet published?
Q5: Should Computer Crime Act (2007) be supplemented with any post-2007 amendments or companion legislation?
Q6: Is full Chapter 23 (principal enactment) available for detailed amendment mapping?
Q7: What embedding model and vector DB are specified for Antigravity pipeline ingestion?
Q8: Should confidence scores be adjusted based on manual legal review, or used as-is from NLP extraction?
